meanings.definition: Strong support for a particular cause or group.
meanings.sent1: Her partisanships for the local animal shelter were well-known in the community.
meanings.sent2: Political partisanships can sometimes lead to heated debates.
meanings.sent3: His extreme partisanships for chocolate ice cream always made his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The partisanships of the fans for their favorite team were like a roaring ocean of support.
meanings.sent5: The partisanships of the volunteers made the charity event a great success.

meanings.definition: The state of being a partisan.
meanings.sent1: The intense partisanships in the election divided the town.
meanings.sent2: She was proud of her partisanships and always stood up for what she believed in.
meanings.sent3: His partisanships were so strong that he even wore his team's colors to bed.
meanings.sent4: The partisanships of the two groups created a visible divide in the community.
meanings.sent5: The partisanships of the students were evident during the school council elections.

meanings.definition: The activities or actions of partisans.
meanings.sent1: The partisanships of the rebels were causing unrest in the region.
meanings.sent2: The partisanships involved organizing rallies and protests.
meanings.sent3: Their partisanships included wearing matching hats to show their unity.
meanings.sent4: The partisanships of the group were like a well-oiled machine, always working together.
meanings.sent5: The partisanships of the team members were crucial for their success in the competition.
